review:
My boyfriend and I love this app. It’s fun and the questions are thoughtful.

I wish there was a way to better see what discussions are new. I often want to see what my boyfriend has said about specific questions we’ve answered but some conversations will have a new notification even though they have not had an update. It makes it difficult to check new messages from my partner without going to every. Single. Conversation. Please fix!!
title: New Discussions

developerResponse: {'id': 29455432, 'body': "Hi, thanks for taking the time to try out Paired and leaving a review!\nWe do, on the free version, have a question available per day and a quiz on Sundays. But if you do want to access all content available in the app, you will need to subscribe to the premium version. We've tried to set a price that is both fair and representative of the expert content we've created with therapists and academics to make sure that we can help couples invest more in their relationship. If you feel that this isn't the case and you can spare a few minutes to share your feedback with us, please shoot us a note at\xa0support@paired.com. Thanks!\xa0🙏", 'modified': '2022-04-28T16:42:40Z'}
review:
I heard about this app on tiktok then downloaded the app because it sounded so cool. I got the app and signed up and paired with my boyfriend and then we see that you have to pay to use the app. Maybe include this in your ads or have that “pay us” option before people sign up for the app, it was a waste of my time and I was really excited just to be let down. 

I just want to make it clear I’m not upset that the app asked me to pay to use it, I’m upset with the way the set up, it almost tricks you and is very misleading.
title: A little misleading

developerResponse: {'id': 37384096, 'body': "Thanks for giving Paired a try. I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your experience. We do, on the free version, have a question available per day and a quiz on Sundays. But if you do want to access all content available in the app, you will need to subscribe to the premium version. We've tried to set a price that is both fair and representative of the expert content we've created with therapists and academics to make sure that we can help couples invest more in their relationship. If you feel that this isn't the case and you can spare a few minutes to share your feedback with us, please shoot us a note at\xa0support@paired.com. Thanks!\xa0", 'modified': '2023-06-28T16:01:08Z'}
review:
This company is out of their mind if they think this app is worth $15/ a month. The free version is horrible and offers almost no questions. This was a decent idea but is completely ruined by the greed of the company and their misguided belief they are worth this much.

**Update** I have left my feedback with the developer through the channel given. It is essentially the exact thing I pointed out here. You offer nothing close to the value of $15/month. Everything you offer is readily found on the internet for free.

Slap a $4.99 a month subscription price and see more people keep the app and use it.
title: Not worth $15/ month at all.

developerResponse: {'id': 33837747, 'body': "Thanks so much for your review! We've shared your comments with the rest of the team.\xa0We hope the app can keep bringing you and your partner even closer 🙏\xa0If there's anything else you'd like to share, you can always shoot us a note at\xa0support@paired.com 💜", 'modified': '2022-12-20T17:10:56Z'}
review: Me and my boyfriend use this app every single day. It has really helped our communication skills and understanding each other better. It helps us talk about things we don’t like talking about in person and gives us topics we never even thought about discussing. This app is so worth it! I would definitely recommend to anyone. I would give it more stars if I could.
title: Love this app!

developerResponse: {'id': 34337829, 'body': "Thanks a lot for your feedback regarding Paired and the games we offer! It has been passed on to the dedicated teams for review 🙏 If there's anything else you'd like to share, don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com! ", 'modified': '2023-01-17T14:54:47Z'}
review:
We just started using this, I really do feel like it makes us feel closer. We have now started bringing the questions in more depth in person afterwards and that has really made an impact. 

Only thing I wish was more intuitive was the way it shows what we got right and wrong at the end of some of them with the checks and Xs. We didn’t know how to read it for the longest time. It’s confusing at first.
title: Like it, but the checks and Xs are confusing.

developerResponse: {'id': 38174511, 'body': "Thank you so much for your review! We're so happy that Paired can be a safe space for you to connect with your partner 💜 If there's anything we can do for you, please don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com!", 'modified': '2023-08-08T17:14:28Z'}
review: Me and my fiancé has been thru some tough times and to be quite honest this app has helped us understand each other and listen to the words that they are putting out. It gives us both the option to say what we need to say without judgement then we get to discuss our answers at the end. Bottom line great app for any relationship
title: Relationship problems

review:
This app is a great way to bond with your partner and I love how it sparks discussions we couldn’t possibly have thought of.
However, my girlfriend and I are both estranged from our families. That’s something we’re not ashamed of having in common. I wish the daily questions and monthly quizzes didn’t assume we have family members in our lives-even our chosen family is still being developed over time. Thanks for reading.
title: Enjoying it but…

developerResponse: {'id': 39641111, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your feedback about Paired! \nWe understand that you don't feel comfortable with some of the content we offer. We're currently working on ways to personalize the content offered in the app, so that all couples can find what's most relevant to them and their relationships ✨ If there's anything else you'd like to share, please don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com — we always love to know what our users think of Paired!\n", 'modified': '2023-10-20T16:09:19Z'}
review: It’s pretty ok although you can tell that the developers are incredibly left wing. Some of the questions are uncomfortable. One question example answer was pretty much that making out with someone or sleeping with someone where there was no emotional feelings was ok to do but another questions example was that they would be “devastated” if a partner used an AI bot to write love letters. Pretty screwy if you ask me. But for the most part the app has helped our relationship. We just don’t do the uncomfortable question packs.
title: Pretty ok

developerResponse: {'id': 33836719, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for your feedback 🙏 I understand that the price of our Premium offer is inconvenient for you and your partner at the moment. If you'd like, we also offer a monthly plan - it might be better suited to your current situation. In the meantime, I shared your comment with the rest of the team, and don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com if you need anything else.", 'modified': '2022-12-20T16:26:14Z'}
review:
I love that we have daily questions. Questions that my husband and I never really thought to ever ask us, or to get us out of our comfort zone. It brings new conversations into our daily lives and has made us laugh and talk things out. 

I loved the first day I downloaded it and was able to play a few games with him. Great for conversation - again that we probably would have never thought to bring up. We laughed and learned new stuff. We have been together 12 years. 

However, the second day we have to pay for everything minus the daily conversation. 
It’s not a bad price but, it’s just inconvenient for us when we are trying to get finances right and about to have another big move. I wish there were daily free games at least.
title: Love and dislike

developerResponse: {'id': 35739495, 'body': "Thanks a lot for taking the time to leave such a positive review 🫶 We're thrilled to hear that the app has been helpful to you and your fiancé! \nIf you have any questions regarding upgrading to Paired Premium, or any further comments you'd like to share, don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com - we'd love to hear more of your thoughts 💜", 'modified': '2023-04-03T11:24:39Z'}
review: I convinced my fiancé to download this with me on the day we got engaged and we’ve been using it everyday since! We’ve been using the free version which just has one question a day, but I’m seriously thinking about getting the premium subscription for us. It asks us questions we’ve never even thought about. I highly recommend it for any couple
title: My fiancé and I love it!

developerResponse: {'id': 27634847, 'body': "Thank you very much for taking some time to leave a review 🙌 We are delighted to see that you are enjoying using Paired, even though some of the questions don't apply to your relationship dynamic. We'd be curious to hear more about your experience with Paired - if you can spare some time to send some more feedback, please contact us at support@getpaired.com\xa0✨", 'modified': '2022-01-24T17:21:25Z'}
review: Could be better. At least a third the questions don’t really apply to our dynamic. Not having children and not being a traditional couple the questions seem to be geared towards more nuclear family dynamics. It is good and we are enjoying it. It is definitely creating conversations we may have never had otherwise. Wish one of the answers was N/A
title: Good but

developerResponse: {'id': 32623979, 'body': "I'm sorry to hear you're having issues accessing Premium after your partner purchased a subscription. We were made aware of issues applying the membership to the second partner, and this should now be fixed. If you haven't done so yet, please email us at support@paired.com so we can review it together 🙏", 'modified': '2022-10-17T15:57:48Z'}
review: Honestly, the business practices are really misleading and borderline shady. My partner purchased the $74 yearly plan so that we could both play the games and quizzes. It allowed this for a few days, and now all of a sudden only he can start the games/quizzes, and I’m blocked from initiating without paying for the subscription myself. I can’t find anything in the FAQ about this, and shouldn’t have to read through pages and pages of Terms and Conditions to find out that this would have been the case. It should have been upfront information.
title: Misleading…

developerResponse: {'id': 24977384, 'body': "So sorry you're encountering these issues with Paired. This should not be happening! One subscription does unlock premium for both partners so your husband should not have been prompted to purchase a subscription if you already had one.\nIf you haven't yet, please do get in touch with us at support@getpaired.com so we can investigate further. 🙏", 'modified': '2021-09-08T09:09:26Z'}
review:
This app can’t even come close to figuring out how to keep my husband and I in our separate areas… The names keep switching, we keep getting indications for each other (AS the other) and the emails aren’t even kept straight. This was a futile exercise in stupidity.

Moreover, for some reason he was offered a subscription price of $20 less than I was, but only after I signed up. It is completely unclear whether or not both members of the couple even need to pay, but it allowed us to subscribe twice, which is really not OK. We consider ourselves pretty text savvy, but this was a huge fail.
title: No, this is a terrible app

developerResponse: {'id': 37824678, 'body': "Hi there!\n\nWe're so sorry you've had issues with your streak lately. Our support team would love to look into this further with you. Please email us at support@paired.com and we'll sort out your streak and your Conversations Answered counter 🙏", 'modified': '2023-07-21T15:02:55Z'}
review:
I enjoy the interaction with my hubby through the app, but the app is so frustrating! When I complete the Daily Question, I get several reminders to answer the question so I don’t lose our streak, but I have lost it twice now, thinking I had done it on busy days and got no reminders. I think they are backwards! 😞

Also the counter for the Conversations Answered has been messed up for months. I’ve answered everything my hubby has, and yet it shows he has answered 22 more than me.
title: Love/Hate it

developerResponse: {'id': 38528655, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback 🫶 We also believe that everyone can benefit from working on their relationships, so we're glad to hear you've been enjoying using Paired!\n\nIf you need anything at all, our team is always available at support@paired.com 🙏", 'modified': '2023-08-25T15:52:11Z'}
review:
The app itself is for a wonderful cause, and I believe does its job effectively. It opens up connections without being harsh or overly critical. 

Aside from the idea of the app being great, I was completely impressed with the reminder that my free trial was up, and being asked if I wanted to continue. Up front and honest business practices like that is refreshing to see.
title: Enjoying both app and principle

developerResponse: {'id': 23773290, 'body': "Hi! I'm sorry you're encountering an issue with Paired and your partner's responses to this Question Back. If the steps provided haven't solved your issue, please do let us know so we can look into this problem again. 🙏", 'modified': '2021-07-06T10:30:45Z'}
review:
I had been enjoying this app for a month, and I even renewed for a year because they offered a special price. However, 4 days ago I began having the problem of not being able to access my partner’s answers. It’s really frustrating because he answered 20 questions that I can’t see. 
I emailed tech support and they made suggestions to try. I did all of it, but it still doesn’t work. I’ve emailed twice again but I haven’t heard back. If this is what I can look forward to for a year, I would like to be refunded.
title: Unable to access my partner’s answers

review:
I signed up for annual subscription and wife and I have been having a great time “rediscovering” each other with this apps help. 

-One thing I noticed is with last couple updates the store tab was removed? Will this be added back in a later update? We loved sending each other hugs, kisses, etc rewards throughout the day for participating :)
title: Great app for reconnecting

developerResponse: {'id': 34518462, 'body': "Hi there! review: It’s true I’ve been only using the free version for almost a year now but the daily questions worked for us. Sometimes they weren’t relevant but that was ok. What I’m upset about is in the last update you now can’t respond to your partner if they responded to a question and you don’t respond that same day. It makes me feel like they just want money and are making it unusable for anyone else. Some of your customers are working parents and we don’t always get it time to respond and now it’s adding negative pressure to what was fun. If this is a bug I’ll change my rating but I doubt it.
title: I was a 5 now a 1

developerResponse: {'id': 29578021, 'body': "Hi there! \nThanks a lot for taking the time to write a review and share your thoughts with us 🙏 I hope Paired will keep helping you and your partner get closer together! review: Hello! I just wanted to say the app is very helpful and alot of fun for my partner and I, and we have been learning alot about each other. Majority people in the world adhere to some sort of faith or belief and yet its not even an option. That is why I will have to give three stars. If it had options for this I would give it 5.
title: No Faith/Religion based choices.

developerResponse: {'id': 38174675, 'body': "Thanks so much for your lovely review!\xa0We're so pleased you're enjoying using Paired with your wife 💜 \xa0If there's anything we can do for you, please don't hesitate to get in touch with us at\xa0support@paired.com 🙏\n", 'modified': '2023-08-08T17:25:39Z'}
review:

We just started using it but have already had so much fun with the topics and journeys. 
Thanks Paired Team.
title: Great conversation starter

review: The app appears to be fairly easy to use and cute but the only issue I have with it so far and I’d why I gave it 3 stars is because it assumes people are monogamous. My partner and I are polyamorous and have other partners that we would like to use this with as well to further deepen and grow those relationships but from what I can tell I can only have one partner in this app. Monogamy should be a conscious choice not a default. Please update your app to take into account those of us who are ethically non-monogamous.
title: Poly people exist

developerResponse: {'id': 39639810, 'body': "We're so happy to hear Paired has been helpful to you and your relationship 🙌 We love to hear how Paired makes our users' lives better, and it's such a pleasure to see that it helps you feel more love in your busy lives 💜\nCongrats on your engagement, and don't hesitate to reach out at support@paired.com if there's anything we can do for you at all 🫶", 'modified': '2023-10-20T14:56:20Z'}
review:
I’m not one to write reviews, I’m a busy med student — but I really love this app & concept. My fiancé & I were in the height of wedding planning stress & needed some love & something just for us, amidst our busy schedules & crazy families.
This app has been it for the last month. I laugh & think daily & learn new things about my amazing partner. Easy & fun to use.
Well worth the $. Feeling appreciative!
title: Freshly engaged & loving Paired

developerResponse: {'id': 30354829, 'body': "Thanks so much for your lovely review! 🥰 We're so pleased you're enjoying using Paired. review: My husband and I are both really enjoying taking the quizzes and answering questions we just never thought to ask. We are learning more about each other and I like that. Sometimes you can be with someone so long and start assuming their likes and dislikes. This helps us go back to the learning stage of our relationship. I’m really enjoying it.
title: Enjoyable

title: Great App!

developerResponse: {'id': 25910271, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback and for giving Paired a try! At the minute, supporting multiple partners in the pairing settings of the app isn't possible. 🙏   However, we've already set up tips for non-monogamous relationships and strive to create content inclusive of all relationships. \nHopefully that doesn't stop you from enjoying your experience with Paired but do let us know if you have any more comments or suggestions to share with us by sending an email to support@getpaired.com 💜 ", 'modified': '2021-10-26T17:23:11Z'}
review:
I love the concept, but there’s one thing that keeps me from loving the app itself. It’s  limited to two people, I totally understand why though, that’s the norm. But if you’re polyamorous, it can feel limiting.

I’ve been using this for two weeks with one of my partners and we’ve both enjoyed what we get for free but again it feels limiting, my other partners wanna join in too so we can all use it together. If this app could support multiple profiles I’d go straight for premium, even if there was a slight up-charge for every extra person.

TBH, with how left out the polyamorous community is on dating and relationship apps I don’t see why you wouldn’t do it considering the image and customer boost it seems it’d be.

Most likely I’ll delete the app for valuable storage space and find ways to do these activities with my partners myself.
title: Not right for my types or relationships

developerResponse: {'id': 21287989, 'body': "Hi there, so sorry you weren't happy with the content available in Paired. On the free version, each day users can access a Question or Quiz. I hope that helps but if you have any other questions, you can contact us via support@getpaired.com.\n", 'modified': '2021-02-25T10:34:39Z'}
review: I was excited to get the app after seeing such great reviews— my husband and I love to connect through little activities like the ones promised in this app. However, I found that pretty much the only thing available without the “premium account” is a daily question, which can spark some good conversation, but to be honest, I could find the same types of questions online or come up with them myself. For a monthly subscription cost, I’d rather go buy couples’ books with activities in them.
title: Practically useless without payment

review:
This app is great! Has helped me with my relationship and making it stronger. 2 problems.
1. App needs a dark mode
2. App need to be optimized better as it starts to lag during quizzes and games. Especially if you’re doing the activity with your partner the app lags alot.

Hopefully the developers fix those issues, however I highly recommend this app if you’re going through a rough patch.
title: Please add dark mode🙏🏽

review: I absolutely love this app. It has very helpful quizzes that can get couples to talk and enjoy even more their relationship. I also think there is room for improvement. The app can have other type of activities that can nudge both partners easier and make the process of solving it more fun. We would prefer to have more free quizzes as well!
title: More free quizzes and other activites

developerResponse: {'id': 24694083, 'body': "Thanks for your review! We're so glad you're enjoying Paired. review: My husband and I love this app! The free daily question is such a sweet little way to connect during our busy lives. title: A sweet way to connect

developerResponse: {'id': 27257361, 'body': "Thanks so much for giving Paired a try! We're so happy you're enjoying using Paired and finding it helpful. 🥰 If there's anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to contact us at support@getpaired.com. 🙏", 'modified': '2022-01-05T14:23:01Z'}

title: Fun and practical

review: Make sure your partner has time to do this. My partner suggested this app. I was an active participant and doing a lot of questions during the trial period. title: Great app but it hurt my relationship

developerResponse: {'id': 32169334, 'body': "We're sorry to hear you're having issues with your subscription. One subscription covers both partners. Please feel free to contact us directly at support@paired.com and we can sort this out for you 🙌", 'modified': '2022-09-22T10:28:22Z'}
review: We thought with both of us adding this app that it would only charge us for one but you charged us twice and as much as I like it, paying $160 is just crazy!! Wish I would have known because we honestly wouldn’t have even got it for that price. Wish I could download again next year but again $160 is just insane and honestly a rip off in my opinion. You need to make it more clear about charging both people. It’s an app to help you build a better relationship with your partner so it should be $80 per couple not $80 a per person.
title: Double charge

developerResponse: {'id': 34332372, 'body': "I'm sorry you encountered technical issues when exploring the app, this shouldn't be happening. Our dedicated teams are investigating these glitches, and you should see improvements with the latest version of the app. If your app is updated and the issue persists, please email us at support@paired.com so we can investigate together 🙏\n", 'modified': '2023-01-17T11:20:42Z'}
review: My boyfriend and I love using the Paired app. It’s a great way to get conversations going and get to know each other better. But, since the app updated, we've had countless issues (and this is happening even though him and I have new phones). The app constantly crashes and is always lagging. I miss the version of the app before it updated and would’ve given it 5 stars. This version of the app is definitely deserving of a lower score.
title: AWFUL Since Update

review:
The UI is clunky and slow which is significant given how many conversations are entered and exited. The lack of darkmode is a big downside to battery consumption on OLED devices. And the premium is wayyy overpriced given the similarity to buzzfeed quizzes. At least they have a free trial option. I like this app for connecting partners asynchronously. 

Update: The current version of the app crashes every time I open the Discuss page. This is likely due to not being able to handle the volume of clutter on that page. Very disappointing.
title: Good but not Great

developerResponse: {'id': 35632156, 'body': "I'm sorry to hear you were charged twice for Paired Premium - this shouldn't happen! Paired is meant for couples and one membership does cover both you and your partner. Your report was forwarded to the rest of the team and we'll definitely work on fixing this glitch so that users aren't charged twice for Premium 🙏 \nIn the meantime, don't hesitate to get in touch with Apple support to request a refund if your purchase was made via your Apple ID. Our teams are also available to help if you need anything - feel free to email us at support@paired.com for more guidance on this topic!\n", 'modified': '2023-03-28T10:37:51Z'}
review:
I meant to cancel within the week, but didn’t read the fine print that says cancel the “day before”. Fine, that’s on me, but then my husband also got charged. How it sounded to me was one person got charged, not both, since it requires two people to “play”. 

Some of the games are cute, but not as engaging as I’d hoped. I’m not sure how much we’ll get out of this. We will try to remember to do something with it since we now paid $160! I’ve canceled so I don’t get charged next year. I hope.
title: Cost Waaaay More Than Expected

developerResponse: {'id': 25533477, 'body': "Thanks so much for your lovely review! 🙌 We're glad you're enjoying using our app and hope we can help you connect with your partner every day. Thanks for being part of our community. 💜 If there's anything you need, you can always shoot us a note at support@getpaired.com. 🙏\n", 'modified': '2021-10-06T17:38:49Z'}
review:
I like the app a lot and think it’s hot a lot of potential, I think it could help a lot of couples in a way that’s not as uncomfortable or tense as it would’ve been/ could’ve been without it. 
I do wish it was free though, but I understand the need to profit from the app so I won’t complain about it.
Just wanted to tell the creators good job on the app and thanks for the free trial 😊
title: It’s a good app.

developerResponse: {'id': 28979077, 'body': "Hi, sorry to hear you’ve been experiencing some issues with Paired! This shouldn't be happening. If the app is up-to-date and you're still encountering these issues, please contact us at support@paired.com and share as much information as you can about your issue! We can then investigate further. 🙏 Thanks for your understanding.", 'modified': '2022-04-05T15:20:16Z'}
review:
I will start with saying that it’s a fun concept with decent content. My partner and I have enjoyed the quizzes. That being said, for the price tag, the app is way too buggy and the content quickly becomes stale and reminiscent of high school ‘getting to know you questions’. 

Specific complaints:
1.)You can’t see the answers after you take a quiz (so if your partner picks ‘all the above’, you better hope you remember those answers or you are out of luck).
2.) Random push notifications… for literally no discernible reason, and no way to change the setting 
3.) Stale question options. It’s marketed as a moderately serious relationship app. The multiple choice should have more options. 

Enjoy the free version or try the trial during date night. But I do not recommend paying for this undeveloped app at this time.
title: Buggy App and poor UI

developerResponse: {'id': 33837867, 'body': "Thank you so much for your review, it's such a pleasure to see that the app is helpful to you and your partner 💜 We hope Paired can keep sparking more meaningful conversations, and don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com if there's anything we can do for you ✨", 'modified': '2022-12-20T17:17:07Z'}
review: We have only been using this app for a few days but I feel more connected with my partner already. There’s a sense of comfort with answering questions by yourself and then letting your partner see them. I also like the curated quizzes and how it provides some variety for conversation and discussion so it’s never really dull.
title: Great way to get to know your partner!!

developerResponse: {'id': 23675343, 'body': "Hi there, sorry you didn't enjoy your experience with Paired. The quiz and questions are meant to be a tool to open up conversations. They are science-backed and fun ways to get couples to talk about topics they might not have spoken about before or not recently. Most of our users have found that the app prompted new conversations either face to face or through the chat feature we have in the app - which is something we absolutely encourage as, like you, we don't believe leaving it at a smiley face is very helpful. \nIf you have any other questions or feedback you'd like to share, don't hesitate to contact us at support@getpaired.com. But thanks anyway for giving us a try.", 'modified': '2021-06-30T11:38:42Z'}
review: This app caused more points of contention than it solved. Comparing your feelings rather harshly against each other. We recently played a card game that was somewhat similar, but made you talk face to face about yourself feelings on a particular subject. Finding out if someone gave a frown face or a smiley face on a given subject over an online platform is just way too broad and opens up the flood gates for misinterpretation. After a face to face conversation about this app, we're much happier deleting it and talking in person about our feelings. 10/10 would not recommend.
title: Didn't like the comparison format

review:
I was given a 7 day free trial and told that it was ending on a particular day.  The afternoon of that end date i tried to cancel the plan as I couldn’t see this app as the best fit for our relationship but when I tried to cancel it basically said too late, and took the payment.  

I guess the ending date must have had a time  deadline (Maybe the hour and minute that I had originally had signed up) as it appeared that I could have cancelled that morning.  Is what it is, so I’ve cancelled basically a year in advance.

I would assume that this may be a good app is both of the couple is into this kind of thing but didn’t think that was the case for us…

Guess I have an App that will mostly go unused and they got my $50.  Whatever you do, cancel the free trial a day earlier than the date they say it ends as it definitely doesn’t end at 11:59pm on the  cancellation date…. Lesson learned.
title: Ripped me off

developerResponse: {'id': 32556088, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks a lot for taking the time to share your thoughts with us 🙏 Your idea to add a Suggestion box has been forwarded to our dedicated teams - if you can spare the time, don't hesitate to send us more feedback at support@paired.com 💜", 'modified': '2022-10-13T13:42:46Z'}
review: I have an idea though, a Suggestion area on the app for the question of the day from us. For example I can put in a question I have thought of into the suggestion place and the app randomly asks the question for the daily question! We do love the app though, it’s our daily morning activity to start the day on a good vibe.
title: We love it.

developerResponse: {'id': 27634865, 'body': "Thank you for taking time to share a review about Paired. We're sorry to hear that you have been charged twice, your husband and yourself. If you need any assistance with anything at all, or wish to share some more feedback regarding your experience with Paired, please feel free to email us at support@getpaired.com\xa0🙌", 'modified': '2022-01-24T17:23:16Z'}
review: I liked the idea of this app & thought it would be fun for my husband and I to answer quizzes/ questions in our downtime. I decided to invest in the premium subscription; however, I just realized today after going through year end bank statements that both my husband & I were individually charged for the app! I sent him the link via text so we can be “paired”, so this should not have happened. Super disappointed that I’m now going to have to go through the hassle of getting my $$ back, when this should not have happened in the first place.
title: Double Charged!!

developerResponse: {'id': 34336220, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for taking the time to try out the app and sharing this feedback following our recent update. Feel free to email us at support@paired.com if you have any question 🙏", 'modified': '2023-01-17T13:50:36Z'}
review:
My husband and I have used paired for almost a year and have really enjoyed it. They recently have taken away the ability for you to answer previous days questions if your partner has answered them unless you pay for the full app. For a while they had “legacy chat” where that was still an option but it seems that is gone. 

I don’t appreciate companies that reduce what they have to offer. I recommended Paired to dozens of people but now I’m not sure we will even continue using it ourselves. Very disappointed.
title: Ruining the experience

review: My husband and I have been using this for a couple weeks and we love it! Although, we both did the update that came out today and now we can no longer play the games. It let's you select the answer and won't proceed to the next question. Luckily everything else works.  Please fix!
title: Update Caused Bug

developerResponse: {'id': 39641230, 'body': "Thanks so much for leaving us a review! We're glad you're enjoying using Paired and we hope we can continue to spark interesting and fun conversations with your partner to help you learn even more about each other ✨\nIf there's anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to shoot us a note at\xa0support@paired.com 🙏\n", 'modified': '2023-10-20T16:16:32Z'}
review: My boyfriend and I have both been married previously in unhealthy relationships and have every intention of keeping this relationship healthy. The games, questions and prompts on the paired app are facilitating communication in a level we hadn’t even imagined. It’s like couple counseling/ classes but more fun! It’s helped us to grow so close in every area!
title: We love this app!

review: Pricing and subscription is not forthcoming until you've gone through full account setup - I would not have bothered had I known upfront how expensive it is. Cost seems very predatory and reading the reviews here I get the impression that many of the 5 star reviews are bought as they all have very similar testimonials. If it were more affordable to try with a month to month (it's $15/month btw), I might have given it a chance - but to receive the trial period, you have to sign up for annual subscription (nearly $70 upfront!). No thanks.
title: Way too expensive for a game app

developerResponse: {'id': 34336019, 'body': "Thanks so much for leaving us a review! We're glad you're enjoying using Paired and we hope we can continue to spark interesting and fun conversations with your partner to help you learn even more about each other ✨\nIf there's anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to shoot us a note at\xa0support@paired.com 🙏", 'modified': '2023-01-17T13:43:40Z'}
review: This app is so helpful and creates so much fun and excitement in your relationship. You also get to know your partner very well through simple questions and exercises you get to discuss each section when completed. Very highly recommend this app to anyone and everyone it is $6 a month to get everything and so worth it! DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND GET THIS APP AND THE PREMIUM VERSION!
title: Get this app!

review: Paired has been an incredible resource my wife and I now use to help us find areas in our relationship we can work on and sustain other areas where we are strong. Definitely recommend any couples looking for more ways to further develop and grow their relationship, look no further than Paired!
title: Couples need to download this app!!!

review:
We had the app for four days, enjoyed it, but started getting irritated with the in app pop-up telling us our answers could be saved if we had accounts… I already had a subscription. So I went the log-in where directed, only for it to freeze on several attempts. Once I finally got  to select that I had an account, I entered what I thought was account info, same as the Apple ID, and got denied. 

Developers really ought to streamline the process and include the account/data storage for couples games with the subscription in iTunes.
title: Account Not Included With Subscription

review: I think this app is great, and so far my boyfriend and I enjoy answering little daily questions! But you really don’t get much at all, unless you pay for a subscription. title: Great but having issues!

review:
Once I submit my responses, I see my partners answers as well, but then a few seconds go by and I’m almost always met with an error message making me resubmit my response. It feels disingenuous knowing I got to see my partner’s response to prompts prematurely while I have to re-enter my own without being influenced by their answers I saw unfairly.

TLDR: Love using the free version even if it’s only a question a day, but I’m constantly met with “an error has occurred” almost every time I submit my answer.
title: Constant crashes

review: This app gives my wife and I something new to talk about everyday. Even if the topic or question doesn’t apply to us we are able to talk about how it doesn’t apply or laugh at how lucky we are that it isn’t an issue for us. I recommend this to everyone I come across to help their relationships.
title: Enjoy the app.

review: This app is amazing!! It has helped us talk about uncomfortable subjects and it is helping the communication in our relationship. I definitely think it’s bringing us closer. We have learned so many new things about each other! I opted for the premium version but even the free version is great
title: I would definitely recommend this app!!!

review: My wife and I are really enjoying the app with great conversation starters and questions. Our only issue is that we both downloaded that app with our iTunes accounts and ended up both charged a subscription fee. I would recommend that the developer makes it easier to link two accounts or somehow share one account with a partner easier - requiring only the one subscription.
title: Cool app but subscription issue

review: I thought this would be a fun app for my partner and I to use, as we have the Tuned app right now but were wanting something with more to it, but I didn’t know that this costs $75 per year to use it!! The free version is barely a version at all; you can only answer one question a day and do a quiz once a week. What’s the point of even having the app if you can barely do anything on it without spending half a paycheck? Super disappointed because the app seems really nice but I can’t afford it.
title: you can’t do anything without paying for a subscription

review: We decided to give this app a try. We find ourselves a few days in a row not answering questions or quizzes cause theyre about money and dont apply to us.
Great app otherwise!
title: Mostly Great!

title: Fun app for conversations

developerResponse: {'id': 32168058, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. Sorry you didn't enjoy your experience with Paired. We've shared your comments with the rest of the team who's already working on a smoother chat experience. 🙏 If there's anything else you'd like to share, you can always shoot us a note at support@paired.com 🙌", 'modified': '2022-09-22T09:31:46Z'}
review: I love this app. But it’s very frustrating how you have to chat separately from where you answer questions. They should have chat threads for every question. It would make it easier to have an ongoing conversation. Especially if you’re answering multiple questions at once. It makes it so hard to keep track of where you are.
title: 5 stars if you could respond if the chat functionality was better.

review:
I am quite annoyed at this app at the moment. My wife and I downloaded the app last week. It wasn’t for us, which is okay, not everyone has the same tastes or needs.

However, today I attempted to unsubscribe in order to not be charged the $75. The app told me I had successfully unsubscribed with 15 hours left in my free trial. And now I’ve received an email that my Apple account was charged $75.

I am currently seeking a rebate through Apple, but potential customers be advised that you may be charged even if you attempt to cancel your “free” trial.
title: Frustrating

review:
It’s been useful so far and I’ve been enjoying it! My spouse and I are long-distance and it’s really taking it’s toll. Having tangible numbers and goals works really well for my autistic brain. 

I think there should be a section focusing on trauma and military. Untreated trauma destroys relationships and I don’t see much of this right now.
title: Additional Resources

review: My ex bf and I have been off and on for 5 years and we used to use this app all the time! We are getting back together soon and I hope this app helps us again! He is really the love of my life, but i hope this app leads us in the right direction again. 10/10 would recommend!
title: My ex and I

review: Basically nothing on this app is free.  Based on previous reviews, seems like it is borderline impossible to get out of it.  I’m deleting immediately as the free stuff on the app is such a small sample size that it’s impossible to know if it is any good without spending $75.  No thanks!
title: Don’t download unless you are planning on $75/yr

developerResponse: {'id': 32557077, 'body': "We're sorry to hear you're having issues with replies not being sent properly! Recent updates of the app should help fix this issue, please make sure you visit the App Store to install the latest version of Paired. If there's anything else you need, don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com 🙏", 'modified': '2022-10-13T14:34:05Z'}
review: The app looks great, and for being a paid app I would expect it to work. I have an iPhone 13 pro max - but I doubt that is why when I answer quiz questions it doesn’t actually submit my answer so I’m having to redo a quiz 5-6 times before it actually takes. Which is really frustrating if you’re really expressing yourself and have to write it all over again. Glad I only paid for a month, I won’t be paying for another unless those quiz’s get fixed. Especially since it’s what I’m paying for…
title: This app barely works

developerResponse: {'id': 27036822, 'body': "Sorry to hear you're having issues with Paired Premium. Please send a message to support@getpaired.com and we can sort this out for you. Thanks! 🙏", 'modified': '2021-12-24T13:05:51Z'}
review: So we did the free trial and loved it, decided to continue with premium. My boyfriend is the one that did the subscription and he can answer any questions/quizzes when he wants to but I do not have access to any of them except the free daily ones. If he answers new questions/quizzes I can answer but only after he has even though we pay for premium. Everytime I try to it brings up the prompt for me to pay for premium.
title: Paid for premium but only one of us can answer

developerResponse: {'id': 34338213, 'body': "Thanks so much for giving Paired a try! We're so happy you're enjoying using Paired and finding it helpful 🙌 \xa0If there's anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to contact us at\xa0support@paired.com! 🥰\n", 'modified': '2023-01-17T15:07:21Z'}
review: This app actually makes it easier and a bit more comfortable to break into some of the underlying problems in relationships. I don’t know why it helps, maybe it’s the disconnect from actually having to have hard discussions face to face… idk, all I know is that it’s helping a lot…
title: It may sound stupid buuut….

developerResponse: {'id': 36354457, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for sharing your thoughts on the pricing of the app. We do offer a free trial in our yearly plan which allows you to test the Premium version for up to 7 days before paying for the 12-months membership. Please note as well that one membership will also unlock Premium for your partner, so one payment will cover you both!\nIf you have any additional questions or comments about our memberships, don't heistate to email us at support@paired.com 🙏", 'modified': '2023-05-05T17:19:01Z'}
review: First thing I will say is that I have not paid for the full version, but the only reason I have not done so is that I can’t find if I want to commit to the money or not without being able to try it out, but I can’t get it out if everything I want to try on it is locked behind a paywall. I want to try it, I really do, but with everything so limited without paying, I find it hard to commit without being able to try more of what I want.
title: Can’t prove itself

developerResponse: {'id': 26872023, 'body': "Thanks so much for giving Paired a try! We're so happy you're enjoying using Paired and finding it helpful. 🥰 If there's anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to contact us at support@getpaired.com. 🙏", 'modified': '2021-12-16T11:23:13Z'}
review: My fiancé and I live in 2 different states currently and Paired has helped us have fun and learn more about eachother. We joke about getting answers wrong and make bets on who will win games. I would recommend this app to every couple…and the paid version is worth it, we use it daily!
title: Awesome way to stay connected!

review: Great app for couples to use. My partner and I are enjoying all the games, questions and conversation started but The only issue im having is the “Today” page is not working. I cant open any quizzes, games or exercises on the homepage!! I cant even scroll down to see the whole “today” page. Not functioning. Explore, chat, answers and Us is working fine
title: Cant use homepage

developerResponse: {'id': 23758538, 'body': "Thanks so much for your wonderful review. 👏 We're so glad that our app has helped you find some time and a way to discuss some of your feelings and learn even more about each other. If there's any other feedback you wish to share or anything we can do for you, you can shoot us a note at support@getpaired.com. 🥰", 'modified': '2021-07-05T16:54:07Z'}
review: My husband and I are raising 3 kids and have a 4th due in 2 months. He works a lot and we don’t always have the time to sit down and communicate how we’re feeling. This app helps us to communicate on our own time and learn new things about each other. It’s super easy to use and we both enjoy it.
title: Love it!

developerResponse: {'id': 26673049, 'body': "We're sorry to hear you're having issues with your subscription. If you need any help sorting this out, please contact support@getpaired.com 🙌", 'modified': '2021-12-06T15:23:58Z'}
review:
This company is one of many that provides a free trial and makes you cancel prior to them charging you. The difference between this company and the others is that they charge you for an entire year. This is incredibly unscrupulous and they should certainly be reprimanded. Be warned, do not download this app.

Update: I’ve since been contacted by the developer. A bunch of empty words which tells me they are acknowledging that they are doing this and have no moral issue with being terrible. I reiterate, don’t buy from these awful people.
title: Questionable Ethics

review: This app was just what my fiancé and I needed. We love the daily questions and have those discussions. In you truly use the app for what its worth then this will be similar to couples counseling except you will have to hold each other accountable to actually do the daily tasks. If you do them, you will notice an improvement in your relationship.
title: Affordable couples counseling

developerResponse: {'id': 21510348, 'body': "We so glad you're enjoying using Paired. 💜   Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review as well and for sharing your suggestion with us. We are working on a way to let couples talk more after answering a daily question so stay tuned! 😬  If you have any other questions or suggestions you'd like to share, don't hesitate to contact us at support@getpaired.com. ", 'modified': '2021-03-08T09:57:36Z'}
review:
Me & my husband have been together for almost 8 years and even though we have been together for that long, I still learn new things about him because of this app. It opens up conversations that we’ve never had before & it’s great.

 The only thing I wish we could do is to be able to continue a whole conversation once we answer the daily conversation question.
title: Learn about eachother

developerResponse: {'id': 35937107, 'body': "We're glad to hear that using the app with your partner has been helpful to you and your relationship, and we're sorry you had an issue with your trial. By default, trials are set to auto-renew when they expire, and to ensure continuous access to Paired Premium, a payment might be attempted before the end of the 7th day. If you have any questions at all, don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com so that we can help you further \n", 'modified': '2023-04-13T12:01:27Z'}
review:
First, they tried to charge me before my 7 day trial was up. If it’s 7 days free then I shouldn’t be charged until day 8. 
Otherwise, it’s interesting to see the difference in your partner’s answers despite how long you’ve been together. You realize there’s still more to learn about each other and that helps with intimacy.
title: Good, but Could be better.

developerResponse: {'id': 27634987, 'body': "Thanks a lot for taking some time to share your review about Paired. review:
Chat function within the app is the platform for exchanging views on results of quizzes and questions, but the chat function stopped working recently and no reply from customer service. 

I’ve canceled automatic membership because this is a basic function of the app that should be working and until it is again, not nearly as usable and beneficial.
title: Was 5 but some functions stopped working

developerResponse: {'id': 27633644, 'body': "Thanks so much for giving Paired a try! We're so happy you're enjoying using Paired and finding it helpful. 🥰 If there's anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to contact us at support@getpaired.com. 🙏", 'modified': '2022-01-24T16:24:50Z'}
review: My girlfriend and I really love this app. We’ve had good conversations about the prompts that it gives us. It’s important to be honest in the app or you’re missing the whole point and potential growth in your relationship. I wish we could answer more than one prompt without buying premium though.
title: Great App

review: Paired made the app more unusable for those who use the free version. You used to be able to answer yesterday’s free question if you missed it, but now if you miss a question, you can’t go back and answer it because it’s marked premium now. With that there’s also a glitch in the discuss tab notifications where you have “unread” conversations but you can’t get rid of them because they are marked premium. Stupid updates. Paired was much better before recent updates.
title: Recent update made Paired horrible

review: I can think of about three billion things that are less annoying than seeing a little notification badge on the “discussions” tab. That’s really annoying and as a developer myself, it’s not a hard thing to do.
title: Discussions tab has ruined it for me

developerResponse: {'id': 35655585, 'body': "Thank you for your review and your suggestion on our Discuss tab! review: The only complaint I have is, under the discuss tab there should be a “responded” “pending answer” “answered” with filters to find certain past convos or questions. Other than that this app has brought my wife and I much closer together and connected
title: Great app I just have some feedback

review: I love the idea and the concept. But if the idea were really to help people why not make it accessible for people who can’t afford to buy the content. So many marriages could be helped and saved but just like therapy it’s inaccessible to most because of finances. So sad. Wish you would make a lite version for people like me who are a 1 income family!
title: Wish it was more accessible for people who are struggling financially

review: We got the free trial and we were instantly hooked! When it came time to buy the premium when the trial ran out, I was all in. review: It’s a nice concept and I’m sure it is great if you pay for premium. One random question each day that may or may not be relevant isn’t super worth it to me. I just wish this app worked and had more available in the free option.
title: Not Really Worth It

review: This app is awesome for opening up dialogue around a variety of topics. The only thing I would change would be the ability to discuss answers on questions. As it stands now we end up going into more depth around the prompts after seeing the other person’s answer.

At least in my mind, in my own sense of comfort and stability. Thank You, Creators.

title: Streak

review: So far we’ve been doing the free daily questions and felt we were getting some good information and feedback from each other that we are now trying the one year membership. Nice we got it at a discount for the first year!

review: This app has really helped my fiancé and I discuss some big things regarding our lives together and the way we feel about things. The question pack about preparing for a wedding was super insightful into how we’ve actually got different ideas and hopes for our future. It’s grown us as a couple and as people. I really love him and I’m glad this app has been so beneficial.
title: Life

developerResponse: {'id': 35638686, 'body': "We're sorry your partner was unexpectedly charged for Paired Premium after you cancelled the renewal of the trial on your end.\nWhile trials do auto-renew if not cancelled, please note that Paired wouldn't charge any user that hasn't confirmed the in-app purchase beforehand. If you'd like to get more information on what happened exactly, don't hesitate to email us with your account details at support@paired.com - our teams will be more than happy to go through the history of events with you!", 'modified': '2023-03-28T15:48:12Z'}
review: I downloaded this and tried the premium with my partner for a week. I set it all up and was told my partner gets it free when I share. We decided not to move forward with the trial and I canceled in time, but they charged HER for the full year of premium automatically. Very shady and misleading as all she did was accept an invite from me who supposedly was the owner of the account. Once I chose not to pay, they charged her card without her knowledge and she’s now in a dispute with Apple to get her money back. Beware
title: Beware You Both Need To Cancel

review: App used to be much better because I could answer questions a day or two late now you have to answer them before the next daily question or you have to pay. So much for their free question again. Feels company with sub standard practices and is trying to force people into paying monthly/yearly. They get paid enough for just getting answers. How about some transparency. This app will be deleted along with all my data. If I have to I’ll get the stone rolling on other fronts. Users be warned.
title: Going down hill

We are reunited and renewed in our hearts because this app has taught how to connect and communicate with each other respectfully!!

My Best,

review: Love the app, it really does bring conversation and helps strengthen the relationship. My only ask would be when pages are shared it directs you to the web browser, then to the App Store and then when you click app it doesn’t take you anywhere.

review:

review: Bf and I used this during long distance and it really helped to keep connected. We did not use the paid version which meant we got one daily question a day. This worker great for us but the app seems to have bugs as some days we wouldn’t get a question and others we’d get multiple
title: Great for long distance!

review: I was offered a free 7 day trial and then discount for 1 year subscription. However I had an initial problem just signing in, I reached out to customer service multiple times and the only response I ever received was to be patient. To this day I have still not received a reply, even when I informed customer service I was cancelling the last day of the trial and alerted my credit card company not to accept any charges. Good luck hope others are more successful then I was!
title: Don’t use this app as customer service is UNACCEPTABLE

{'id': 39640047, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback about Paired!

review: I expected this app to be about me and my partner, but there were parts where they gave you multiple choice answers instead of letting you fill in an answer for things like “What movie would you pick on movie night?” All 4 of the choices were movies I’d either never seen or did not like. review: They will charge you for a whole year of access if you don’t cancel before the free trial is over. review: My husband and I are loving the questions.  They’re so much better than “how’s work going?”.  It’s such a nice way to connect and deepen our relationship after being married almost 6 years. Your relationship is well worth $5/month!
title: Worth it.

developerResponse: {'id': 32624041, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review and giving Paired a try!\xa0💜\xa0We hope you're enjoying using the app. If there are any more thoughts you'd like to share, either regarding the pricing or the app in general, don't hesitate to shoot us a note at\xa0support@paired.com.\xa0🙏", 'modified': '2022-10-17T15:59:56Z'}
review: I have had 1 to 4 hour conversations with my beautiful baby girl every time we are together so conversations are easy for us ❤️ BUT I love this added option of topics that are brought up and seeing what they say is pretty interesting
title: Kinda brilliant

review: You can only answer one daily question for the free trial? Literally not even 2 categories that could be free? I have to pay 60$ to help improve my relationship? Boyfriend and I deleted it as soon as we saw how there was only one question a day for free, not worth having the app if you don’t have the money to spend on silly questions. Gonna see if the other app that’s like this one is better, and allows people who don’t have a ton of money to also enjoy this.
title: Seriously?

developerResponse: {'id': 37825121, 'body': "We're sorry to hear you've been having issues saving answers in the app - please get in touch at support@paired.com so that we can look into this further 🙏\nIn the meantime, we hope that Paired will help you stay connected with your partner while you live apart and brings you even closer than ever 🫶", 'modified': '2023-07-21T15:31:27Z'}
review:
It has difficulty saving answers so I’ve found myself typing the same response 5+ times with little success. Please fix! 

Other than that what an adorable app! My partner and I just embarked on long distance and I look forward to this helping us stay connected.
title: Bug Fix

Don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com for more guidance on this topic!", 'modified': '2022-10-27T14:58:51Z'}
review: My wife and i tried the app, and the idea is fine, but we did not think we would use it consistently enough to warrant paying after the free trial. Well, i forgot to cancel (my fault) and they auto-charged me….for a whole year. The problem is I cannot find ANY way to cancel. Apple tells me to contact them and i have tried multiple times on the app to no avail. So i paid $75, don’t use the app, and they will not allow me to cancel or even stop renewal for next year!!!!
title: Scam

developerResponse: {'id': 34338068, 'body': "Thanks a lot for giving Paired a try and taking time to share your thoughts! review: The questions they ask are really impressive and they ask things both me and my partner of 4 1/2 years never thought of! However, you have to pay an egregious price to unlock all the questions and content, which is a little ridiculous. I’d pay $1-$3 for the app and get everything, but to pay $75 for a 1 year subscription…. It’s a little ridiculous for the content the app carries.
title: It’s okay

review: My bf and I live almost 2 hours from each other and recently reconnected after 28 years apart after my marriage of 27 years ended.   This has helped us learn more about each other since we reconnected.  Love it!!

review: Using Paired as a fun and new way to introduce all sorts of topics of conversation between myself and my spouse. I downloaded it off my therapist’s recommendation to prepare for some upcoming changes for us and immediately saw it’s value. We have been premium members ever since!

review:
This is so great for people who are disconnected from emotion. It’s fun and light. If they’re not willing to try this. Leave them. It’s simple with daily reminders. You get to know them and yourself on deeper levels. 
Try with friends and family to!
title: I love this.

developerResponse: {'id': 30284996, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We do offer free trials with our yearly subscription offer. If you'd like to know more about this, please do shoot us a note at support@paired.com 🙏", 'modified': '2022-06-10T13:14:09Z'}
review:
I’ve used another app, Tuned, and stopped for a long time. Recently I’ve decided to give another couples-specific app a try and landed on this. 

While I don’t doubt the app’s capabilities, the app is so blatant with the paywall to do anything at all except for one thing per day. It doesn’t allow me to explore anything before wanting to commit to it.

If you’re lucky enough to be in the same time zone, it’s great.

review:
I think the concept of the app is really good. My boyfriend and I really enjoy the written prompts and think they’re great for starting conversation about topics that might be difficult to bring up.

However, there are quite a few bugs in the app.
- the daily streaks are not accurately recorded
- the timer for a new conversation on the free version of the app could have ran out, but my partner and I still weren’t able to respond to the daily conversation
- my partner and I can’t see each other’s “reactions” to our responses when looking at the prompt page
title: Really good concept, but a lot of bugs

What we discovered on THE first day is that we don’t trust each other thanks to a quiz that we both took.  Now divorce is being discussed.  Thanks Paired.  We were fine before downloading this app.  Can I send you the legal fees??

review: I had to give this app a 1-star today because of today’s quiz which is, “gender roles at home.” The term “gender roles” Is so outdated and was created for a hetero relationship in 1955. Time has changed and so has the concept of gender, especially for those that identify in the LGBTQ+ community. This quiz made my boyfriend and I comfortable; I guess I expected too much from this app.
title: Heteronormative Questions

developerResponse: {'id': 36354414, 'body': "Thank you so much for your review, it's such a pleasure to see that the app is helpful to you and your partner 💜 We hope Paired can keep sparking more meaningful conversations, and don't hesitate to email us at support@paired.com if there's anything we can do for you ✨\n", 'modified': '2023-05-05T17:16:23Z'}
review: My relationship was in shambles, literally the most unhealthy place it could be. We had problems with communicating with each other problems with trusting each other, vulnerability, and even just a healthy and open line of communication. this app will have you to answer questions, play games and take quizzes while doing it. It just seems like you’re answering a question but the fact of the matter is the questions that are being asked, will warren deeper conversations. And I can honestly say where we have had conversations and ended up yelling at each other, or there were things that we wanted to address, but did not know how to bring it up. This app will put you inside of your partners head and put them inside of your head. We’re just a few simple question and it gives you a room to learn more discuss or even wait later if need be. I think one of my favorite parts about the app is when we answer questions about ourselves and each other, and it allows us to see how much we know each other but sometimes when you get a response or answer from your partner, it allows you to see how they view you, but it also allows you to give reason to whatever that thing with that reason is. this app is very costly and honestly I probably would not have it if I caught it before the seven day trial ended. But now that I have it I am she was going to thousand dollars for it so is you are on the fence about getting this app I want to be the thing or the person that encourages you to jump over the fence. This app is great!!!
title: This app is great I recommend 100%

review:
When you answer a question, it’ll often give you a suggestion for an answer so that you have an idea of how to answer…

The question was ‘what three things would you put on your couples bucket list?’ 

Cool question. Could be interesting and fun… for the suggestion… they said ‘bingo, paintball,

 … DRAG SHOW’ who in their right mind thinks ‘ya know what I want to do before I die? I want to see gay strippers with my wife/SO! Yeah. That sounds fun’ 

I’m tired of this sick crap. I recommend finding a different app that doesn’t do this crap.

review: I’m currently living out of the country for a year and my spouse and I decided to try this app to stay connected. Sometimes they ask really good questions other times it’s just way out in left field. They are obviously secularists who couldn’t imagine anyone else with different values living in the world using their app. Some times your mind gets blocked in answers and so the “example responses” are supposed to kick start your creativity. The problem is  many times their “example responses” could only apply to sexual libertines and moral relativists. Even in their questions they sometimes push sexual ethics and boundaries to inappropriate places. Their questions suffer from the same myopic vision. Sometimes their questions only make sense to people steeped in their post-modern secular western value system. Could Amish even understand these questions? How about English speaking Africans, Catholic South Americans, Religious African Americans, English speaking Muslims, English speaking Hindi, Confucian Chinese? Nope most of these questions and answers are framed around white science worshiping secularists and their value system. As an example, “ Where do you see yourself relationally in Five years?” Example response: “Still in our Non-monogamous relationships but we have told our families.” Is this seriously what 90% of married couples want to have celebrated in 5 years? Like I said it’s a bit of a crapshoot some days are good other days my wife and I are like where did that question come from?
title: Weird but generally ok

review:
We have been using for a month and overall, the app is pretty good. But, I think there are a few key areas that if modified would majorly improve the app and user experience/benefit—especially for a paid service and continued subscription.
1) the app should personalize/filter the content pushed to its users so it’s relevant to them .This could be accomplished in the initial couple profile creation and questionnaire. ex. If I am married to a man and we are both straight, content related to the queer experience isn’t relevant or helpful to improving our relationship, whereas it could be helpful to others who fit that criteria. There are areas in the app that do only apply to those dating vs those who are married, divorced etc., and those with kids or without and contemplating having them.
2) I thought the chat function as it is currently setup would be more helpful than it is. The app would benefit from having a separate notifications section so one partner is notified when the other completes a questionnaire, quiz, etc. I think it would be more helpful if the couples could “chat” within each actual questionnaire, open ended question, quiz once completed. The reactions function in the open ended questions is nice, but would be much better if you could also enter comments, follow-up questions etc. to your partner as well. This provides an opportunity for a conversation to be started between the couple after reviewing answers. Unless you and your partner are physically sitting next to each other when completing and reviewing these things (which the majority of the time is not the case we have found), I think the benefit is reduced without that “next step”.
title: Overall Good - But Improvements Needed!

developerResponse: {'id': 27493975, 'body': "Thanks so much for your review! We've shared your comments with the rest of the team. 🙏 If there's anything else you'd like to share, you can always shoot us a note at support@getpaired.com. 🙌", 'modified': '2022-01-17T16:36:33Z'}
review:
Before I make any comment on why the app is only 3 stars for me, I first will say that this app had been really good the first few months of using it! Me and my lover had fun and learned a lot about each other. I think we grew more comfortable with ourselves in the process :) Sadly, those few months weren’t meant to last.

Some updates introducing new questions to the game started to become unanswerable. They would indicate that I was supposed to be with my partner IRL for me to answer it, otherwise it would just be pure speculation. For example, (in simpler terms), “how DO you both manage work around the house?” There were multiple flaws within this question; one of which being that we are long distance and this is something we have no experience with. So, we started to guess. We would basically form an idea of what would happen if we DID live together.. so we wouldn’t lose our streak and so we would fill our unspoken quota of answering at least one question on the app per day. 

This worked for a while, especially with the release of ‘games’ which made my partner intrigued on a whole new level! However, things gradually got worse. There came a point where answering the questions seemed pointless because they became irrelevant to us. We had no way of knowing the answer and, since we don’t live near or with each other, it was always guessing. I checked the questions every day for about a month (whereas my partner had given up about 2 weeks into this) and we collectively decided to give up. The app had become useless to us now and ultimately not fun and a waste of time. Don’t get me wrong, it’s still a good app! Though, if you are in a long distance relationship, this may not be the one for you.
title: Anti-LDR

{'id': 31367040, 'body': "We're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your experience with the app.

Every couple's experience is unique, and we want to promote conversation around topics that can be beneficial to most couples. It means that we can sometimes touch on light-hearted, fun topics, and this is balanced with heavier conversations sometimes. 
We are also working on personalizing the content we offer our users, so that you can see the conversations that are the most relevant to you and your partner.
If you have any questions, or want to share more comments about your experience with the app, don't hesitate to get in touch at suport@paired.com!", 'modified': '2022-08-09T14:19:21Z'}
review:
My husband and I are using the free version. It’s only 1 question a day, which, I feel is inadequate. I feel if the app had way more quality questions, this could be a great tool. However, we’ve been using it for a few weeks now and maybe 3 questions actually sparked an actual conversation surrounding the question. Everything else has been incredibly LAME. For instance, today’s question was: “How much do you think couples vacations should cost?”  What on earth is that supposed to accomplish in a marriage? No vacation *should* be only a set amount. It depends on the experience you are looking for. But my biggest annoyance is, these kinds of questions don’t feel  they are useful for us. How is discussing how much we think a vacation should cost going to spark a deep, thoughtful conversation?  Yesterday’s question was: “When was the last time your partners family or friends helped you out?” Why is this relevant? It would be nice to get more personal, in depth questions that are specific to a relationship and not a bunch of hypotheticals for life and other people in general.  The quizzes (the only 2 we’ve gotten) are also boring. 

Basically this app is good for couples who want to keep life vanilla or to avoid connecting on a deeper level but makes you think you are just because you’re answering these questions. 

Hey Paired! If you want us to spend the money to have full use of the app, maybe give a little bit better sampling of what this app has to offer because so far, I’m sitting here wondering why it even costs money at all because the free questions are barely worth our time.
title: Super lame, and no thought-provoking questions

review: There is NOTHING to do in this app unless you pay for it or do the free trial. You get like one boring daily question a day. Typical money  grubbing app

{'id': 39823852, 'body': "Hi there!

Thanks a lot for sharing your review of Paired.

Both of your suggestions have been passed on to the rest of the team,  and we'll take them into consideration when planning our future updates 🙏

If there's anything else you'd like to share, don't hesitate to get in touch at support@paired.com!", 'modified': '2023-10-30T13:44:37Z'}
review:
hi! my boyfriend and i have been using paired for about seven months or so. we really like it, but i have a couple of suggestions that i’m surprised haven’t been addressed and implemented because i definitely don’t think we’re the only couple who feels this way.

1. questions (especially the questions in the monthly quiz) should be paired with the length of time a couple has been dating. the app asks for your special dates, like an anniversary. i’m sure there’s a way the developers can work with the practitioners who create the questions to use a couple’s relationship timeline so the questions asked more appropriately align with where they’re at in their relationship.
2. in quizzes and games, there should be an option to fill in the blank. i understand it would be hard to score, but im sure there’s a way to figure out how to make it work. because there are some questions that literally do not apply to us and make no sense to our relationship and/or who we are as people. for example, the emoji game where you have to choose which emoji relates more to one person vs the other, would be a perfect game to implement the “fill in your own response” option because some of those emojis were ones we’ve never used or don’t apply to us at all.
 
the app is great, these are just a couple of suggestions that i think would really make the app improve dramatically…especially having questions that align with the timeline of our relationship. maybe even having its own separate section?

i hope y'all take these suggestions into consideration and implement them somehow!! thank you!

review: They charge both you and your partner $60 & they don’t make that clear, BEWARE
title: Waste of $

review:
I have been using this app for a little bit over a year. All in all, it’s a great app that’s super engaging and has brought a lot of laughs and insight to my relationship. I guess I just wish that some of the answer choices for some of the games were more relatable. I mean.. who wrote this stuff? For example, a question could be something like… “what is your ideal date night?” And the answer choices might be something along the lines of:
a.) dinner & a movie 
b.) meeting the parents
c.) a play at your favorite local theatre 
d.) a long walk down the city sidewalk 
But it’s like.. uhhhh.. WHO WATCHES PLAYS?? Not all of us live near the city either… so you’re basically left with one forced generic option to choose from. Lol it’s either the answers are so generic and boring or they’re completely unreliable or unrealistic. 

The only other thing that I wish was different was if you complete or answer an activity and are waiting for your partner to complete/answer the same one, it shows up in a list. This is okay. But I wish that when your partner did the task too that it notified you rather than just remaining in the list. Sometimes it’s just difficult to keep track of when there is SO many items in the list.. you don’t know which ones to go back and look at their answers. Maybe a little banner/notification on the task that says something like “partner answered question pack or quiz” would make it a lot easier.  

All that aside it’s a great app that I do highly recommend. I do pay for the premium version as I feel it’s added a lot of value to my relationship.
